work.name: Microsoft (Activision Bilizzard King)
work.summary: Lead the AI4Game Research over the topics of representation learning, reinforcement learning, graph learning and causal ML, supervise Master/Ph.D. students, drive research collboration with organizations such as MIT, DTU and Microsoft Research.

work.name: Motherbrain, EQT Group
work.summary: Lead applied research on large-scale knowledge graphs, oversee academic publications and knowledge sharing initiatives, supervise Master’s theses focused on AI for investment, and collaborate with external laboratories and universities to advance AI research efforts.

work.name: King Digital Entertainment
work.summary: Develop ML platforms and use cases such as user profiling, real-time recommendations, and reinforcement learning game agents, conduct state-of-the-art research surveys on AI in gaming—including AI that plays, creates, and understands games.

work.name: Amap, Alibaba Group
work.summary: Conduct fundamental research and applied computer vision algorithms for the backend data center, and implemented an online platform to automatically extract and update roads from aerial maps, operating 24/7 to double production efficiency.

work.name: Elisa (Polystar)
highlights: 2010.03 - 2013.04 General managing the Beijing branch, overseeing cross-functional teams.
Responsible for building a commercial telecom big data visualisation and analytics platform.

work.name: Ericsson
work.summary: Troubleshoot, integrate, upgrade CDMA Core Network Systems.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Best Reviewer
awards.awarder: ACM SIGKDD Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining (KDD 2024)

awards.title: Nordic 100 in Data, Analytics and AI

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
